sentences.sContent: They paid him only $10 for it and it really rankled.
sentences.sCn: 他们为此仅支付给他10美元，真让人气愤。

sentences.sContent: Their refusal to sell the country arms in 1937 still rankled with him.
sentences.sCn: 他们在1937年拒绝向该国出售武器一事仍然令他愤愤不平。

sentences.sContent: The only thing that rankles me is what she says about Ireland.
sentences.sCn: 唯一让我愤懑的是她有关爱尔兰的那些言论。

remMethod.val: 阶级 (rank) 矛盾引起人民的怨恨 (rankle)

trans.tranOther: If an event or situation rankles, it makes you feel angry or bitter afterwards, because you think it was unfair or wrong
